extent.charseq: his senior colleague Senator John McCain
the first US senator to meet with Brown
a freshman senator from Massachusetts arriving to burnish the conservative credentials of the GOP's 2008 presidential nominee

One man presented him with a baseball, and Brown took out a marker and signed his signature along with .41, a reference to his election, which gave the GOP 41 votes in the Senate, and stripped Democrats of their 60-vote supermajority.
a long-shot candidate running for the seat left vacant by the death of Edward M. Kennedy
Phoenix residents seeking Brown's autograph in a crush after the rally
a nondenominational Christian school whose sports teams are known affectionately as the 'Lopes
the gymnasium of Grand Canyon University, a nondenominational Christian school whose sports teams are known affectionately as the 'Lopes
McCain's chief opponent in the Republican primary, former congressman and talk radio personality J.D. Hayworth,
people approached the freshman Massachusetts senator, taking photos with cellphones and asking him to autograph McCain campaign stickers
